intro: Cupaniopsis squamosa, commonly known as the squamosa hakea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine, scaly texture. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Cupaniopsis squamosa is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
